org.xmlcml.euclid
Class IntArray

java.lang.Object
  org.xmlcml.euclid.ArrayBase
      org.xmlcml.euclid.IntArray
All Implemented Interfaces:
EuclidConstants
public class IntArray
extends ArrayBase

array of ints IntArray represents a 1-dimensional vector or array of ints and is basically a wrapper for int[] in Java There are a lot of useful member functions (sorting, ranges, parallel operations The default is an array with zero points All arrays are valid objects. Attempting to create an array with < 0 points creates a default array (zero points). Since int[] knows its length (unlike C), there are many cases where int[] can be safely used. However it is not a first-class object and IntArray supplies this feature int[] is referenceable through getArray() note that the length of the internal array may not be a useful guide to the number of elements

Author:
(C) P. Murray-Rust, 1996

IntArray

public IntArray(IntArray ref,
                IntArray sub)
         throws EuclidException
create mixed sliced array. use another IntArray to subscript this one where I(this) = I(ref) subscripted by I(sub); Result has dimension of I(sub). caller is responsible for making sure elements of sub are unique

Parameters:
ref - matrix to slice
sub - subscripts.
Throws:
EuclidException - if any of I(sub) lies outside 0...refmax-1

IntArray

public IntArray(IntArray m)
copy constructor.

Parameters:
m - array to copy

IntArray

public IntArray(int nn,
                java.lang.String shape,
                int maxval)
Create customized array. create a given 'shape' of array for data filtering An intended use is with IntArray.arrayFilter(). The shapes (before scaling by maxval) are:
  • "TRIANGLE"; 1/nn, 2/nn, ... 1 ... 2/nn, 1/nn; nelem is set to 2*nn - 1
  • "ZIGZAG"; 1/nn, 2/nn, ... 1 ... 1/nn, 0, -1/nn, -2/nn, -1, ... -1/nn,; nelem is set to 4*nn - 1
step is maxval / nn

Parameters:
nn - number of elements
shape - TRIANGLE or ZIGZAG
maxval - used to compute step

IntArray

         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
construct from an array of Strings. must represent integers

Parameters:
strings - values as Strings
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - a string could not be interpreted as integer

applyFilter

public IntArray applyFilter(IntArray filter)
apply filter. convolute array with another array. This is 1-D image processing. If filter has <= 1 element, return this unchanged. filter should have an odd number of elements. The filter can be created with a IntArray constructor filter is moved along stepwise

Parameters:
filter - to apply normally smaller than this
Returns:
filtered array

trim

public IntArray trim(ArrayBase.Trim flag,
                     int limit)
trims array to lie within limit. if flag == BELOW values below limit are set to limit. if flag == ABOVE values above limit are set to limit. by repeated use of trim() values can be constrained to lie within or outside a window does not modify this.

Parameters:
flag - BELOW or ABOVE
limit - value to constrain
Returns:
new array

public IntSet indexSortAscending()
